newsitem.title: TAIWAN: TAIWAN CENTRAL BANK INJECTS T$10 BLN IN FUND.
newsitem.headline: TAIWAN CENTRAL BANK INJECTS T$10 BLN IN FUND.

text.p: Taiwan's central bank, responding to rising money rates on tight liquidity, injected T$10 billion worth of funds into the banking system through open market operations on Saturday, a central bank official said.
The bank executed a repurchase of negotiable certificates of deposit, treasury bills and government bonds offered by interested financial institutions with a rate of 8.600-8.875 percent.
The institutions have the option of repurchasing the NCDs, treasury bills and government bonds in 12 to 14 days, the official said.
The bank injected T$15 billion worth of funds into the banking system on Friday in two open market operations.
The overnight interbank rate closed at 9.265 percent on Friday against Thursday's 8.862 finish.
It stood at 9.194 percent at 0400 GMT on Saturday.
